intro: Octolobus, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Polygonaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their basal rosettes of lanceolate leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Octolobus species are generally herbaceous perennials with a fibrous root system.
